column5: First boat trip for my son. Bass isn't open yet close by, so panfish were the plan. Lots a juice and snacks. Even brought an electronic toy just incase. Didn't need the toy, just a rope for him to play tug-of-war with his uncle. Enough fish to keep him happy and after 5 hours on the water the grown-ups were the ones who were ready to head home.           And at a busy lunch time launch there was only one bozo.
Awesome Rob. I will have to get my grandson out soon as well. He looks to be the same age as your little guy.
Excellent report and pics, Rob. Things that make a family stronger......

All things considered on a beautiful June Saturday, one is almost tolerableâ€¦ But he was a beaut.  He's almost 4 and a half and if you post a photo of your grandson with a brookie bigger then anything I've even seen I'll quit.  The hope is he likes it now, and loves it when he's 15. I'll start working on his sister in a couple of years.
Looks like a nice day on the water.  Nice report man!
Great to see he's enjoying fishing.Lots of good memories to be made!!!!!!  .
Some great pics Rob.  Many good years ahead dood!
Yup, he looks very happy! A pleasant father's day weekend for sure
